item.title: Elise add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Albus Severus," Harry said quietly, so that nobody but Ginny could hear, and she was tactful enough to pretend to be waving to Rose, who was now on the train, "you were named for two headmasters of Hogwarts. One of them was a Slytherin and he was probably the bravest man I ever knew." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Elise add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Yeah, Quirrell was a great teacher. There was just that minor drawback of him having Lord Voldemort sticking out of the back of his head!" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Elise add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Elise add a quote by Meg Cabot
item.description: "Wait. Why am I thinking about Krispy Kremes? Weâ€™re supposed to be exercising." -- Meg Cabot

item.title: Elise add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Elise add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Elise add a quote by Kate DiCamillo
item.description: "There is nothing sweeter in this sad world than the sound of someone you love calling your name." -- Kate DiCamillo

item.title: Elise add a quote by Wataru Yoshizumi
item.description: "this book puts the FUN in Disfunctional" -- Wataru Yoshizumi

item.title: Elise add a quote by Meg Cabot
item.description: "Who knew an elf queen could be so vicious!" -- Meg Cabot

item.title: Elise add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love." -- Charles M. Schulz
